description: You have /a/Cogwheels/a/, but it's time to learn how to --really-- use them: controlling /e/Rotational Speed/e/.

When you place a /a/Cogwheel/a/, /b/either Large or Small/b/, you can /b/hold a cogwheel of the other siz/b/e /7/(large + small, small + large)/7/, and you'll find that a /b/ghost silhouette/b/ pops up to the diagonals when hovering over the placed /a/Cogwheel/a/. This function is called /e/Placement Assist/e/: it'll help you place these diagonal cogwheels with ease, along with a bunch of other components.

When you right click with the assist there, it'll place in that position; and you'll finally /b/shift some gears/b/. When you shift gears, the /b/speed either doubles or halves/b/, depending on what you're powering. Powering a /a/Large Cogwheel/a/ connected to a /a/Small Cogwheel/a/ /b/doubles the speed/b/ coming out of the small cogwheel.

And vice versa, powering a /a/Small Cogwheel/a/ connected to a /a/Large Cogwheel/a/ can /b/halve the speed/b/ coming out of the /a/Large Cogwheel/a/. /7/(Yes, slowing the speed down will be useful in the future.)/7/

Finally, /b/these speed changes can be chained/b/! Just with a couple of shafts, /b/you can double it even more/b/. Just /b/bring a shaft out of the faster cogwheel/b/ and /b/attach it into another large cogwheel/b/, shifting gears again.
/7/(You can make it more compact using Andesite Casing to cover up the cogwheels' shafts by encasing it, but this will be left as an exercise to the reader ;))/7/
